video.title: Brain Games
video.synopsis: This interactive series uses games, illusions and experiments to illustrate how our brains manufacture our reality and often play tricks on us.

episodes.synopsis: Just as movies use image and sound to create illusions of reality, our own senses can be fooled into thinking we hear or feel things that don't exist.
episodes.title: Watch This

episodes.synopsis: Magicians and experts use the art of illusion to show that the brain's ability to pay attention only to selected stimuli also makes it easy to fool.
episodes.title: Pay Attention!

episodes.synopsis: Experts look at the way the brain creates and recovers memories, showing that memories change over time, and the brain may even create false memories.
episodes.title: Remember This

episodes.synopsis: Put your concentration and attention to the test to learn how your neuronal wiring can affect what your brain chooses to focus on at any given moment.
episodes.title: Focus Pocus

episodes.synopsis: Scientists explain how our remarkable brains can measure something as abstract and invisible as time and share tips on how to enjoy its passage.
episodes.title: It's About Time

episodes.synopsis: Explore how our brain detects, interprets and reacts to movement, and see how easy it is to fool it -- for better or for worse.
episodes.title: Motion Commotion

episodes.synopsis: Science shows how fear sharpens the senses and mental capacity, why you get shivers down your spine and why you shouldn't be afraid to be afraid.
episodes.title: Don't Be Afraid

episodes.synopsis: The science behind the power of persuasion -- the tricks and techniques used every day to influence people -- shows how easily we can be swayed.
episodes.title: Power of Persuasion

episodes.synopsis: Despite the misconception that we understand everything that goes on around us, science shows that we know a lot less than we think we do.
episodes.title: What You Don't Know

episodes.synopsis: Interactive games and experiments reveal the surprising ways men and women's brains can differ and how that affects our behavior and mental capacity.
episodes.title: Battle of the Sexes

episodes.synopsis: Interactive games dazzle the eyes, exploring optical illusions, how the brain constructs reality and why you can't always believe what you see.
episodes.title: Seeing Is Believing

episodes.synopsis: Interactive games and experiments unveil the decision-making process, proving that our everyday choices are not as trustworthy as we think they are.
episodes.title: You Decide

episodes.synopsis: Like muscles, the brain needs exercise to stay healthy. A brain fitness test offers ways to sharpen the mind and improve concentration and memory.
episodes.title: Use It or Lose It

episodes.synopsis: Interactive games reveal how your brain is like a time machine that can "see" the future and endow you with X-ray vision.
episodes.title: Illusion Confusion

episodes.synopsis: Brain games and studies reveal why and how often we lie, what goes on in the brain that lets us stray from the truth, and how to catch a liar.
episodes.title: Liar, Liar

episodes.synopsis: Contrary to popular belief, there are brain functions that improve as we get older. This episode, we’ll show how the brain doesn’t always act its age.
episodes.title: Battle of The Ages

episodes.synopsis: Do you know the colors you see? Do you think an apple is really red and leaves are really green? We put your brain to the test with interactive games.
episodes.title: In Living Color

episodes.synopsis: This episode, we reveal the secrets of attraction through interactive games. Get ready to find out that beauty isn’t skin deep, it goes much deeper.
episodes.title: Laws of Attraction

episodes.synopsis: Can you trust your own brain? You’ll be amazed to find out all the ways your brain plays tricks on you... sometimes it’s better to trust others.
episodes.title: Trust Me

episodes.synopsis: How your brain manages stress and how stress manages you. Don’t let stress take over, there are ways to handle it. Sit down, relax, and take it easy.
episodes.title: Stress Test

episodes.synopsis: This episode we explore spatial awareness, testing the limits of our sense of direction. With games and experiments, we’ll teach you a new technique.
episodes.title: What's Going On?

episodes.synopsis: Do you have to make due with the brain you were born with or can it be improved? Can you train your brain every day? The answer might surprise you.
episodes.title: Retrain Your Brain

episodes.synopsis: This episode, you’ll be amazed to find out how your brain and your body work together in perfect harmony, and how easy it is to lose that connection.
episodes.title: Mind Your Body

episodes.synopsis: On Brain Games, you’ll find out what drives us to compete, why some people are more competitive and how a little friendly rivalry can be a good thing.
episodes.title: In It To Win It

episodes.synopsis: We show why yawns are contagious, how imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, and how to find out if your brain is a natural leader or follower.
episodes.title: Follow The Leader

episodes.synopsis: This episode is about compassion and the brain. We’ll explore your brain’s capacity for compassion and question your altruistic or selfish motives.
episodes.title: Compassion

episodes.synopsis: We all have something we can’t live without, like coffee, smart phones or social networks. But do we really need them? We learn about addiction.
episodes.title: Addiction

episodes.synopsis: Is language more than just words? How well do you know your language? Brain Games puts your brain to the test with interactive games and experiments.
episodes.title: Language

episodes.synopsis: Are you a risk-taker? Do you eat healthy or junk food? Play the stock market or invest in real estate? It’s time to place your bets on Brain Games.
episodes.title: Risk

episodes.synopsis: Battle of the sexes on Brain Games. Which sex will come out on top in this clash of the minds? The masculine and feminine brain go head to head.
episodes.title: Battle of The Sexes 2

episodes.synopsis: This episode is about superstition and the brain. We’ll play a series of games that will demonstrate that the brain is designed to believe.
episodes.title: Superstition

episodes.synopsis: Many food companies care more about what's on the box than inside it; the ingredients coloring some of your favorite eats include insects and coal.
episodes.title: Food

episodes.synopsis: We all get angry every once in a while. But what if getting angry has more to do with what’s going on in our brains and what can we do about it?
episodes.title: Anger

episodes.synopsis: This episode you’ll find out that what you think is free will is really a habit, and we’ll show you the good and bad side of forming habits.
episodes.title: Patterns

episodes.synopsis: Have you ever had the strange sensation you know something, or something bugs you, without knowing how or why? That sensation is the key to intuition.
episodes.title: Intuition
